summary: Mitchell Livingston Werbell III is an individual who appears in CIA and FBI records primarily in the early 1970s. The documents suggest he had some form of contact with the CIA, although the exact nature is not specified. He faced legal troubles, including the revocation of his Department of Defense security clearance and an indictment on drug charges. The CIA was concerned about his potential to reveal classified information or agency connections. The documents also mention FBI investigations into alleged CIA activities, where Werbell's name came up during security record searches.
significance: Based on the provided documents, the significance of Mitchell Livingston Werbell III in the JFK assassination context is not explicitly stated. The documents focus on his legal issues, security clearance revocation, and potential connections to the CIA, without directly linking him to the JFK assassination. Further documents would be needed to establish any relevance to the assassination.
